availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jeremiah "Jerry" H. Conkin (Monroe County, KY, assistant county court clerk)

body.p: Monroe County, Kentucky, assistant county court clerk. Tennessee native. Son of John C. Conkin and Nancy Conkin. Married to Nancy Harland Conkin. Father of Roberta Conkin and Rosetta Conkin. Attended school in Monroe County, Kentucky, in 1850. Assistant county court clerk in Monroe County in 1860. Farmer in Monroe County in October 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States_ (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 380A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, Tompkinsville, p. 189.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, Precinct 6, p. 184B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Monroe County, KY, February 1864, p. 201.
"Mrs. Conkin Dies at Daughter's at an Advanced Age," Park City Daily News (Bowling Green, Kentucky), July 6, 1926, p. 1.
